meanings.def: twice as much or as many as usual
examples: a double helping
a double espresso
two double whiskies
a double lesson of English

meanings.def: having or made of two things or parts that are equal or similar
examples: double doors
a double-page advertisement
‘Otter’ is spelt with a double t.
My extension is two four double 0 (2400).
a high-profile double murder case
Olympic double gold medallist Mo Farah

meanings.def: made for two people or things
examples: a double bed/room
a double garage

meanings.def: combining two things or qualities
examples: a double meaning/purpose/aim
It has the double advantage of being both easy and cheap.

meanings.def: to perform two roles or functions at the same time
examples: This device can pull double duty as a decent laptop and an adequate tablet.
She deserves credit for serving double duty as a host and performer.

idioms.def: to perform two roles or functions at the same time
examples: This device can pull double duty as a decent laptop and an adequate tablet.
She deserves credit for serving double duty as a host and performer.

meanings.def: twice as much or as many as
examples: His income is double hers.
He earns double what she does.
We need double the amount we already have.

meanings.def: a number or amount that is twice as much or as many as another number or amount
examples: He gets paid double for doing the same job I do.
The airline announced it would start charging double for people who couldn't fit in a single seat

meanings.def: to become, or make something become, twice as much or as many
examples: Membership almost doubled in two years.
double in something The town has approximately doubled in size since 1960.
The material I was buying suddenly doubled in price.
double something The firm has promised to double the number of women promoted to partner by 2025.
Double all the quantities in the recipe to make enough for eight people.
The party almost doubled its share of the vote to 21%.
The price of houses has nearly doubled in the last ten years.
This percentage could easily double.

meanings.def: to bend or fold something so that there are two layers
examples: She doubled the blanket and put it under his head.

meanings.def: to hit the ball far enough for you to get to second base
examples: He doubled to left field.

meanings.def: in twos or in two parts
examples: I thought I was seeing double (= seeing two of something).
Fold the blanket double.
I had to bend double to get under the table.

meanings.def: at twice the amount; to twice the extent
examples: You have to be careful, and this counts double for people with children.

meanings.def: a person or thing that looks exactly like another
examples: She's the double of her mother.

meanings.def: an actor who replaces another actor in a film to do dangerous or other special things
a bedroom for two people
examples: Is that a single or a double you want?

meanings.def: a glass of strong alcoholic drink containing twice the usual amount
examples: Two Scotches, please—and make those doubles, will you?

meanings.def: a game, especially of tennis, in which one pair plays another
examples: mixed doubles (= in which each pair consists of a man and a woman)

meanings.def: the fact of winning two important competitions or beating the same player or team twice, in the same season or year
examples: She’s going for the double this year—the Olympics and the World Championship.

meanings.def: quickly; hurrying
a risk in which you could win twice the amount you pay, or you could lose all your money

idioms.def: a risk in which you could win twice the amount you pay, or you could lose all your money
